drivers.name: bjc600
drivers.comments:
This driver is available in the Ghostscript Printer Application

Ghostscript's built-in standard driver for Canon's inkjet printers.

NOTE: Due to a bug GPL Ghostscript 8.63 crashes when using this driver with PDF input data. With PostScript the driver works just fine.

The bug is fixed in Ghostscript 8.64 and later. For Ghostscript 8.63 (and older) there is a patch available.

The PPDs from this site need Ghostscript 8.64 or newer or the patch to work correctly with PDF input.

notes:
This is a multifunction printer that differs from the C3500 only in the fact that the scanner is a color one (in the C3500 it is B&W).
The documentation that comes with the printer claims that this will not run with NT or Win 3.1. However, the canon site has links to drivers for NT. Printing under non-Win9X systems is accomplished by setting the printer to DOS emulation mode. Under this mode, the printer is driver compatible (according to Canon) with several printers including the Epson LQ2550 and LQ2500 and the Canon BJC 4300 and 4400. The resolution in this case is claimed to be the maximum supported by the driver.
I tried it out with the bj600 and it works. Resolution at which it prints is not known. I have not tried the scanner.

Consumables/Refills: 4 printheads : color, photo color, black, and neon (flourescent
